result.execSummary:
The defendant Christine L Kussow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: 10/24/18 Probation is extended for 1 yr from 12/19/18 to 12/19/19, or until all court obligations are completed, whichever comes first.

miscConds.notes: Crt signed order.   To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $278  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.

Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Dollar General Store, McFarland, WI. Not sell or transfer any real estate or property over $5,000 with agent's approval in writing. Not work as a cashier in any business. Not exercise & banking privileges for any business or another person.
1/8/15: JOC corrected to reflect "Not to sell or transfer any real estate or property over $5,000 without agent's approval in writing." & "Not exercise any banking privileges for any business or another person."

File tax returns timely each yr w/ a copy to agent within 10 days of filing. Any tax refunds to be paid toward restitution. File monthly report with agent showing income expenses and payments made toward restitution. Pay taxes on money stolen by Def. Def to pay $2,000 towards restitution each yr.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: With huber. If late to report to jail, no Huber privileges.
With huber and each yr thereafter until probation is terminated. If late to report to jail, no Huber privileges. Stayed if Def pays $2,000 toward restitution each yr as ordered.
